Score Justification: Multiple micro-craft signals (proper dash usage, dot separators with spacing, tuned scale/leading, stable baselines, consistent casing and contrast) support a 5 despite the minimalism.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: A narrow, offset content column with generous margins creates focus; each project entry forms a two-line unit (title + meta) with even vertical rhythm; the header block (avatar, name/title, compact nav) is aligned to the same column. Reconstruction (Grid/Spacing): Single-column grid with strict left alignment; container width appears intentionally narrow (~60ch) to maintain reading comfort; vertical spacing seems to follow consistent 8/12-based increments; metadata sits in the same column as titles, preserving a clean reading path. Image handling is intentionally absent—no mismatched tiles or device-frame clutter. Link/State Audit: All links are embedded in the flow and respect the same column; no floaty CTAs; focus remains on scanability. Consistency Map: (1) Repeated two-line project blocks, (2) uniform gaps between all blocks, (3) identical alignment for header, nav, and list, (4) steady left rag with no container drift. Failure Theme: Limited complexity (single view, no multi-section galleries), so grid mastery at scale isn’t demonstrated. Anchor Comparison: Very close to Exemplar 16’s editorial index and Exemplar 18’s minimal list; similarly disciplined but fewer sections visible, hence not a 5. Score Justification: Strong structural discipline and rhythm, but with minimal layout variety; awarding 4.

color.explanation: Observations: Neutral-first palette—off-black for titles, mid-gray for metadata and nav; white background with subtle value steps creates hierarchy without noise. The avatar introduces a soft accent but is contained and doesn’t pollute the scheme. Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): Roles are value-driven—primary text (near-black), secondary metadata (softer gray), tertiary nav (lighter gray). Absence of harsh #000/#fff or default bright link blue suggests tuned neutrals. No clashing tiles or mismatched mats, so no value flicker. Link/State Audit: Links adopt text-colored treatment rather than default blue; states aren’t visible here, but the repeated neutral treatments imply a consistent hover/focus plan. Consistency Map: (1) Same grayscale applied to all metadata lines, (2) nav links use a lighter, consistent gray, (3) titles consistently darker for emphasis, (4) background and text contrast remain balanced across the page. Failure Theme: Limited evidence of interactive state colors due to the single view. Anchor Comparison: Aligns closely with Exemplar 16’s neutral system and Exemplar 18’s tuned grayscale; equally restrained. Score Justification: Harmonious neutral palette with clear role separation and no value flicker merits 4.

typography.explanation: Observations: Large, confident display headlines set in a modern sans with tight-but-clean leading; blue inline CTA text with arrow treatment (“Get in touch”, “Get it now”); secondary section headers (“Previously I worked on Framer”, “A quick overview”) keep scale and weight consistent; small two-column body copy beneath the Framer screenshot appears slightly lighter in value. Preflight: sloppy cues = 1 (unreadable fine UI in the Framer mock); template cues = 2 ("I am …" hero; boilerplate footer). Reconstruction: Type Scale shows a clear H1 (~64–72), H2 (~44–52), body (~16–18), micro/meta (~12–13). Leading is ~1.2–1.35 for display, ~1.45 for body; rags are neat and casing consistent (sentence case). Hierarchy is built by size + weight + color (blue accent used for link emphasis). Readability is strong overall; only the light-gray body text under the screenshot verges on low contrast. Baseline rhythm feels stable across sections. Link/State Audit: Links/CTAs consistently expressed via saturated blue text with a right arrow; no visible hover/visited state proof. Consistency Map: repeated heavy display style; consistent blue CTA/link color; left-aligned section starts; recurring micro-label styles and job list icons. Failure Theme: minor contrast softness in the descriptive paragraph block and lack of visible link states. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors are Exemplar 6 (more typographic nuance and documented states) and Exemplar 14 (editorial minimal). Compared to Exemplar 6, this page has fewer documented states and slightly harsher display/contrast; compared to Exemplar 14 it is more systemized and bolder. Score Justification: Clear, disciplined scale and hierarchy with minor contrast/state gaps warrants a strong 4, no caps triggered.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Sections are cleanly segmented with generous vertical rhythm; left-aligned text blocks maintain a consistent container width; the Framer showcase sits on a centered canvas with even mats and a soft shadow; company logo strip is centered on a pale gray band; a full-bleed orange/pink gradient section provides a planned value break; final CTA mirrors the hero structure. Preflight: sloppy cues = 1 (tiny unreadable UI inside the device/screenshot); template cues = 2 (intro hero formula; boilerplate footer). Reconstruction: Grid appears as a fixed central container (~960–1100px) with consistent margins; two-column layout for the experience list aligns cleanly; gutters follow an 8/16 rhythm; spacing above/below CTAs is even and predictable; alignment of captions beneath the showcase matches the container. Image handling: one main product composite with controlled mats; no cut-off crops; radii/shadow logic consistent. Link/State Audit: Primary actions are placed at section entries/exits and maintain the same visual language; no explicit hover/visited proof. Consistency Map: uniform container width across all sections; repeated CTA placement and style; consistent section paddings; recurring “Krijn” pill and corner 3D stickers used symmetrically. Failure Theme: limited breadth of work imagery (one main mock), and the hero structure reads conventional. Anchor Comparison: Nearest is Exemplar 6 (more breadth of disciplined case modules and more refined image sequencing). This page is steadier and more intentional than generic baselines like Exemplar 19’s simple grid. Score Justification: Cohesive grid, spacing, and asset handling across multiple sections with only minor limitations in evidence breadth; merits a 4.

color.explanation: Observations: Neutral shell (off‑black on white) with a single vivid blue accent used for all links/CTAs; one full-bleed gradient band (orange→pink with soft circular overlays) adds emphasis; company logos are monochrome to avoid noise; 3D stickers (blue/yellow) echo the accent palette without overwhelming. Reconstruction – Unification & State Logic: Blue is the clear action role (inline links and big CTAs). Neutrals appear slightly softened rather than pure #000/#fff. The gradient section is reserved for a single CTA block, maintaining role clarity and avoiding rainbow proliferation. Imagery sits on white or pale gray mats, limiting value flicker. Link/State Audit: Action color is consistent, but hover/visited states are not demonstrated. Consistency Map: (1) Blue CTA/link across hero, mid‑page, and final CTA; (2) White/pale gray section shells that unify varied content; (3) Monochrome logo strip; (4) Gradient reserved for one emphasis section only. Failure Theme: A noticeable value jump from white sections to the saturated gradient band and slightly low-contrast light-gray text under the showcase. Anchor Comparison: Close to Exemplar 6’s controlled neutrals + accent approach; this page is a touch harsher/simpler but still coherent. Score Justification: Harmonious palette and clear action roles with minor contrast/state gaps; solid 4.

typography.explanation: Observations: Hero uses a heavy geometric sans in two stacked lines with a smaller gray subhead and a black pill CTA. Testimonials show consistent name/title styling with avatars. Project section headings repeat the same bold display style; links such as “Case Study →” and “Contact Us →” are sentence‑case with arrow glyphs. Preflight: no default blue underline; hierarchy is present; however display weight is very heavy and repeated, and there are no visible link/hover states. Reconstruction (Type Scale): Display ~56–64, section headers ~40–48, body ~16 with ~1.45–1.55 line height; measures appear within 60–75ch; casing is sentence case throughout. Micro‑craft: arrows instead of default underlines, consistent CTA button typography, stable baselines across hero/testimonials. Weaknesses: reliance on one bold weight for hierarchy; occasional long lines in testimonials create loose rags; lack of visible state styles. Link/State Audit: Links are styled as text + arrow and CTAs as black pills; no hover/visited evidence. Consistency Map: (1) Repeated bold headline style across hero and project sections; (2) arrow‑style text links; (3) pill CTAs; (4) avatar + name/meta pattern in testimonials. Failure Theme: Single‑mode hierarchy (mostly size/weight) gives a chunky, marketing feel and limits nuance. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors Exemplar 8 and 19. Versus Exemplar 8 (typography 2), this page shows custom link treatment, steadier scale, and cleaner body leading. Versus Exemplar 19 (stronger), this page lacks nuanced sub‑head/meta styles and tuned states. Score Justification: Readable and consistent but generic, with limited micro‑craft; thus a solid 3.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Centered hero followed by a client‑logo row, a two‑column testimonial grid, and a project section mixing text cards with device mocks. Several device frames (iPad, laptop, multi‑phone stack) display tiny, unreadable UIs. Background tiles alternate between white, bright green, and a purple gradient, causing rhythm breaks. Preflight: Sloppy cues = 4 (three instances of unreadable device mocks; mismatched mats/values across project tiles). This triggers red_flag 'sloppy_images' and caps Layout ≤ 2. Reconstruction (Grid/Spacing): Single wide container (~1100px) with consistent section padding; testimonial cards align to a two‑column grid; project area alternates single and two‑column blocks; gutters are mostly even but visual rhythm is disrupted by varied tile heights and backgrounds. Link/State Audit: CTAs centered under sections; “Case Study →” consistently placed but not always aligned to a shared baseline. Consistency Map: (1) Section headers with generous spacing; (2) repeated pill CTA placement; (3) testimonial card structure; (4) device‑in‑frame presentation for project showcases. Failure Theme: Device‑mock collage with tiny, unreadable content and heterogeneous mats leads to value flicker and weak asset harmonization. Anchor Comparison: Nearest anchor Exemplar 8 (layout 3). This page is rougher: more unreadable mocks, larger value jumps, and mixed tile ratios; compared to Exemplar 19’s tighter card grid, this lacks disciplined harmonization of assets. Score Justification: Due to sloppy_images cap and observed rhythm issues, Layout is 2.

color.explanation: Observations: Shell is light gray/white with dark gray text; CTAs are black pills; text links use a soft blue with arrows. Project tiles introduce saturated green blocks and a purple gradient alongside black device frames. Preflight: mismatched mats/value flicker across project tiles (white card, bright green card, purple gradient, black devices) reduces cohesion; with sloppy_images flag, Color ≤ 2 when flicker stems from mats. Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): Neutral base is acceptable, but accent roles are unclear—black is used for CTAs while project tiles introduce unrelated saturated mats; no visible hover/visited logic. Integration: Diverse project colors are not unified by consistent mats/borders/shadows; laptop/iPad mocks sit on stark backgrounds without tinting to harmonize. Consistency Map: (1) Black CTA pill across sections; (2) blue arrow links; (3) grayscale logo row; (4) white/very light page chrome. Failure Theme: Scattered accent strategy and value jumps create noise; lack of mat/border tinting to unify colorful imagery. Anchor Comparison: Exemplar 8/19 keep colorful work in check via neutral shells; here, saturated mats create more contrast and inconsistency. Score Justification: Serviceable base but poor unification and unclear state logic, capped at 2.

typography.explanation: Observations: • Compact nameplate with light-weight sans; italic serif subhead 'Crafting interfaces.' • Three-column list ('Building / Projects / Writing') with micro-headlines and short body rags. • 'Now' section uses comfortable paragraph measure and even leading; footer line in smaller meta. Preflight: sloppy cues 0; template cues 0. Reconstruction (Type Scale): H1-style name ≈18–20px, subhead italic ≈20–22px with lighter tone; section headers ('Building', 'Projects', 'Writing', 'Now', 'Connect') act as H2s; body ≈14–16px with ~1.5 line-height; meta/footer one step smaller. Hierarchy uses size + tone (italic vs roman) and not just bold. Readability: measures ~60–70ch with stable line breaks; clean rags, no widows. Consistency: repeated casing (title case for headers, sentence case in body), link styling consistent (subtle colored text with external-link arrow). Micro-craft: even paragraph spacing, optical alignment of multi-line items in each column, consistent em-dash spacing in 'performance—' sentence, smart quotes/italics handled well. Link/State Audit: links appear as lightly tinted text (likely custom blue) with consistent external-link arrow mark across sections; no mixed treatments. Consistency Map: • Repeated small-section headers (Now/Connect and the three-column block). • Uniform paragraph spacing cadence throughout. • External-link arrow glyph pattern in lists. Failure Theme: limited breadth (mostly editorial text) so fewer edge-case states shown. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors — Exemplar 16 (Gavin Nelson) and Exemplar 18 (this editorial minimal style). Compared with Ex.16, hierarchy and rhythm are similarly disciplined; less breadth keeps this at 4 instead of 5. Score Justification: Strong editorial minimal craft, clear hierarchy, tuned rhythm; limited variety keeps it at 4.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: • Clear left-aligned single column lead transitions into a balanced three-column grid with equal gutters. • Long-form 'Now' section returns to single column with consistent container width and ample negative space; 'Connect' section aligns to the same grid. Preflight: sloppy cues 0; template cues 0. Grid/Spacing Reconstruction: container width appears fixed with generous side margins; three equal columns with consistent gutters; vertical rhythm uses multiples (even spacing above/below each section); captions/links align to text block left edge; no drift between sections. Image/asset handling: no device frames or cut-off crops; the page relies on typography and grid, which keeps rhythm stable. Link/State Audit: CTA surfaces are inline links; no floaty buttons; navigation is implied by headings and link groups; scan path top→three-column index→narrative→contact is clear. Consistency Map: • Repeated section spacing cadence. • Matching column widths and vertical starts between the three lists. • Consistent left edge for all sections. Failure Theme: conservative, minimal structure with limited complexity; not enough varied modules to prove mastery across many patterns. Anchor Comparison: Nearest anchors — Exemplar 16 (similar restrained structure) and Exemplar 6 (more module diversity). Compared to Ex.6, this is simpler with fewer asset handling challenges, so stays at 4. Score Justification: Disciplined grid and spacing with a strong editorial POV; breadth is limited, preventing a 5.

color.explanation: Observations: • Off-white background with soft off-black text gives calm contrast. • Accent color used sparingly on links and the external-link arrows; no competing hues. Preflight: sloppy cues 0; template cues 0. Unification & State Logic: neutrals are tuned (not pure #000/#fff); no harsh value jumps; accents limited to a single hue for interactive text across all sections, implying consistent states. Integration: no imagery to clash; the neutral shell emphasizes content. Link/State Audit: consistent accent hue for all links, likely with hover/visited handled similarly (not shown but implied). Consistency Map: • Same link color used in intro paragraph, three-column lists, and footer contact. • Uniform neutral background and text tone across all sections. • No stray colored icons or logos. Failure Theme: very conservative palette; state variations not demonstrated explicitly. Anchor Comparison: Similar to Exemplar 16’s tuned neutrals; less varied state evidence than Exemplar 6, hence 4 not 5. Score Justification: Controlled neutrals and a disciplined single-accent strategy that unifies the page without noise; limited state proof keeps it at 4.

typography.explanation: Observations: Large serif display headline in hero; two‑column intro with readable body paragraphs; repeated project blocks with small headings, description copy, and an outlined CTA; later sections include a script display line and reversed type on black. Reconstruction (Type Scale): clear H1 > section H2 > small project titles/body; body measure appears ~55–70ch with ~1.4–1.6 leading; nav/meta are smaller sans. Hierarchy is mostly size+weight with occasional tone shifts (serif display, script accent). Link/State Audit: CTAs use a consistent thin outlined button; inline link styling is minimal/unclear (no visible hover/visited proof). Consistency Map: (1) same project block structure and CTA style across 5+ entries, (2) consistent serif display for headlines, (3) repeated paragraph spacing rhythm in light sections. Failure Theme: voice mixing reduces refinement (serif + script + sans) and reversed small text on black risks readability; link/state system not evidenced. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 8 (typography=2). Deltas upward: more deliberate display hierarchy, better body measure, and more consistent CTA typographic treatment. Score Justification: Competently readable with a defined scale but some inconsistency and limited state proof keep it at 3.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Hero followed by a left‑image/right‑copy intro; then a long list of alternating two‑column project rows (copy left, device mock right) with generous gutters; later icon row and workshop photo, then dark testimonial grid and a hobbies section. Reconstruction (Grid/Spacing): predictable 2‑column grid, centered container, even vertical spacing; tiles have pale mats. Preflight findings: 5+ instances of device frames where UI text is unreadable at the size presented; this counts as multiple sloppy cues (tiny UI inside phone/tablet frames) and triggers the sloppy_images flag and Layout cap ≤2. Link/State Audit: CTAs sit on grid, aligned left, repeated consistently. Consistency Map: (1) repeated two‑column project modules, (2) consistent internal image mats, (3) same CTA placement across projects. Failure Theme: device‑mock collage with tiny, unreadable screens undermines image handling and evidence of product craft; structure reads like a standard template without a strong point of view. Anchor Comparison: Nearest is Exemplar 8 (layout=3). Deltas downward: unreadable mocks across many tiles, heavier reliance on repeated template rows, and a few hard value breaks that disrupt scan. Score Justification: Due to sloppy image handling the layout is capped at 2 despite otherwise clean rhythm.

color.explanation: Observations: Neutral shell (white/light gray) with a soft seafoam accent and thin black outlines; several full‑black sections with reversed text; device images introduce varied app colors but sit on consistent pale mats. Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): neutrals feel slightly tinted rather than pure #fff; mats help unify diverse screenshots; accent teal appears in line icons/illustrations; CTA is outline‑only (state colors not evidenced). Link/State Audit: No explicit link/hover states shown; CTA outline remains consistent across sections. Consistency Map: (1) recurring pale gray image mats, (2) restrained teal accent in iconography, (3) alternating light shell and black sections repeated. Failure Theme: value jumps from very light shell to full‑black blocks create harsh transitions and add minor scan friction; lack of state color proof keeps it from 4. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 8 (color=3); similar restrained palette with mild accent and mats to control screenshot noise. Score Justification: Harmonious and serviceable palette with decent unification, but state logic is under‑demonstrated and the black sections create strong contrast jumps, so 3.

typography.explanation: Preflight: 0 sloppy cues; 1 light template cue (intro line reads like an “I’m [Name]” hero) but overall highly customized editorial style. Observations: (1) Large, elegant serif H1 with tight display leading; (2) intro paragraph measure ~60–70ch with comfortable 1.45–1.6 leading; (3) post list shows clear title vs. meta hierarchy with lighter secondary lines; (4) micro‑labels like “Posts” and “15 of 1,223 posts” in smaller size and lighter tone maintain rhythm. Reconstruction: Type Scale—distinct levels: H1 (display serif), intro/body (text serif), list titles (semibold), list descriptions (regular/smaller), micro‑meta (small). Baseline rhythm appears consistent across hero, list, and footer; rags are tidy. Readability is strong via moderate line length and off‑black text on warm neutral ground. Link/State Audit: links are tinted (not default blue) and sometimes paired with guillemet/chevron markers, implying consistent link affordances across hero and list; states not fully visible in this single view. Consistency Map: repeated treatment for (a) list item titles + light meta; (b) micro‑meta counters; (c) guillemet/chevron affordances; (d) small‑caps/micro label styling in card header. Failure Theme: limited evidence of hover/visited states due to single screen. Anchor Comparison: closest to Exemplar 16 (Gavin Nelson)—similar restrained editorial voice and tuned rhythm; differs by warmer serif tone and fewer sections shown. Score Justification: multi‑level hierarchy, excellent readability, and disciplined micro‑labels justify 4 within single‑view limits.

layout_composition.explanation: Preflight: 0 sloppy cues; assets are purely editorial, no unreadable device mocks. Observations: (1) Stable single main column with a narrow left rail of icons; (2) a unified card (“Posts”) with consistent radius, padding, and a subtle shadow; (3) list items align to a clean grid with even vertical rhythm and clear right‑aligned chevrons/counters; (4) subscribe module and footer align to the same container width. Reconstruction: Grid/Spacing—centered content column, consistent left/right gutters; spacing follows an 8–12pt rhythm; card corners and interior gutters repeat; top hero block and card share the same column width. Link/State Audit: primary interactions (chevrons, “More” pill) sit predictably at row ends; touch targets appear generous and aligned. Consistency Map: (a) matched corner radii across card and inputs; (b) identical internal paddings; (c) right‑side affordances (chevrons/counters) in list; (d) left rail icon placement. Failure Theme: single‑view breadth—no alternate page or dense gallery to stress the system. Anchor Comparison: near Exemplar 16 (Linear minimal)—equally disciplined structure; this page uses a left rail and warmer theme vs Linear’s ultra‑neutral; both keep strong rhythm. Score Justification: clear, cohesive structure and careful asset handling earn a strong 4 with single‑view evidence.

color.explanation: Preflight: no value flicker; neutrals are tuned and consistent. Observations: (1) Warm monochrome palette with off‑white/beige ground and off‑black/brown text; (2) card surface is a lighter value step with a faint border/shadow; (3) links use a subdued, custom tint (not default blue); (4) rail icons and micro‑elements share the same desaturated hue family. Reconstruction: Unification & State Logic—neutral shell harmonizes all content; subtle shadows and border tints separate layers without harsh contrast; accents are sparse and role‑driven (links, chevrons, ‘More’). Link/State Audit: accent color consistently marks interactive text; hover/visited not visible here but the repeated tint implies a system. Consistency Map: (a) consistent warm neutrals across page; (b) identical accent tint for links/affordances; (c) unified shadow/border strength; (d) no loud value jumps between sections. Failure Theme: limited state proof due to single screenshot. Anchor Comparison: closest to Exemplar 16’s tuned gray palette; this page leans warmer but maintains equal discipline and restraint. Score Justification: harmonious palette and restrained accents with clear layer separation merits 4 given single‑view limits.

typography.explanation: Observations: Hero uses a large, confident sans (likely Inter/SF-like) with bold/regular mixing and yellow highlighter accents; project cards show a consistent meta line + title + CTA; testimonial cards pair bold names with lighter role/body. Across hero, project tiles, testimonials, and footer, measures remain comfortable and contrast is solid. Reconstruction (Type Scale): H1 ~64–72px, H2/section heads ~28–32px, body ~16px with ~1.45–1.6 line-height; small meta labels appear in lighter weight and slightly smaller size; left-aligned paragraphs maintain readable 55–70ch measures. Hierarchy is multi‑modal (weight, size, color accent), not just bold. Link/State Audit: CTAs are custom pills with arrow chevrons and consistent weight/spacing; inline links are styled away from default blue; states implied by repeated arrow-button pattern. Consistency Map: (1) Repeated yellow highlighter mark for emphasis in hero and testimonials heading, (2) identical CTA treatment in each project card, (3) uniform meta/title pairing on case cards, (4) consistent name/role/body styles in testimonial cards. Failure Theme: Slightly busy emphasis in hero (multiple bold phrases + highlight) and occasional tight tracking in heavy weights. Preflight: no default link blue; no sloppy crops visible; typography remains steady across sections. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 1 (disciplined editorial sans with custom accents); more decorative than Ex 1 and less typographically spare than Ex 19. Score Justification: Clear, readable hierarchy with consistent styles and custom link treatment merits 4; minor busyness and lack of micro‑kerning perfection prevent a 5.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: The page follows a clear section rhythm—hero, large feature project cards, testimonial grid, client logos, contact/footer. Project cards use generous mats, consistent radii, and measured shadows; devices are large enough to read structure; captions/CTAs align to a stable left edge. Testimonials form a 2×2 grid with uniform gutters and matching card treatments. Reconstruction (Grid/Spacing): Appears to use a centered container (~1040–1200px) with 12‑column behavior; consistent vertical spacing multiples create predictable scan paths; CTAs align within card padding; logos row is centered and evenly spaced. Link/State Audit: CTA arrows consistently placed; cards show a single entry point per tile—no competing actions. Consistency Map: (1) Identical card shells for projects, (2) matching testimonial card radius/shadow and title/role placement, (3) consistent section paddings and full‑bleed tinted bands. Failure Theme: Minor vertical rhythm wobble between project tiles (a large whitespace band before the third card reads a bit floaty) and reliance on conventional modules (hero + card stacks) without strong structural invention. Preflight: No cut‑off crops, no irregular masonry gutters, no mismatched radii. Anchor Comparison: Near Exemplar 1/6—cohesive, deliberate image handling; slightly less tight than Exemplar 6’s gallery discipline. Score Justification: Solid, consistent grid and asset handling with small rhythm roughness keeps this at a strong 4.

color.explanation: Observations: Warm off‑white base, pale yellow banding for testimonial/footer sections, and a signature highlighter‑yellow accent unify the page. Project tiles introduce soft mint/blue mats that sit comfortably with the neutral shell; client logos are desaturated for harmony. Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): Off‑black text with tuned grays for meta/secondary copy; accent role is clear—highlight marks and subtle CTA emphasis; device mock shadows stay neutral without color cast. Link/State Audit: CTAs rely on arrow + subtle tint rather than default blue; color roles are consistent (accent for emphasis only). Consistency Map: (1) Recurrent highlighter yellow used sparingly across hero/testimonials, (2) pale section tints that maintain contrast, (3) desaturated logos preventing palette noise. Failure Theme: Slight value shift between the cool project mats and warm section tints introduces small flicker, but it’s controlled. Anchor Comparison: Comparable to Exemplar 6—tuned neutrals with a defined accent; not as nuanced as the very best palettes. Score Justification: Harmonious, controlled palette with clear roles and good unification across varied imagery merits 4.

typography.explanation:
Observations: Script-style headings (“My Work”, “My Process”, “Recommendations”, “Contact”) with underlines; hero headline uses the same decorative script above a sans-serif paragraph; captions inside work tiles are very small and overlaid on photos. Across sections, body copy appears light/regular sans with long lines in testimonial card.
Reconstruction: Type Scale—display/script ~40–48px, body ~16px; secondary labels in cards ~12–14px. Readability—hero paragraph measure is acceptable, but tile captions and process diagrams are too small to read comfortably; testimonial paragraph lines feel dense with tight leading. Consistency—mixing decorative script for section heads with utilitarian sans for everything else creates a split voice; capitalization and sizing of card titles vary; no visible typographic system connecting tiles, cards, and nav. Micro‑craft—no tuned link underline, no optical adjustments; overlay text sits close to image edges; baseline rhythm between section head, underline rule, and body varies.
Link/State Audit: Links/icons in the header/footer appear default, with no evident hover/active state logic; CTAs are absent or indistinct.
Consistency Map: repeated script section headers with a thin rule; rounded beige cards; overlaid tiny captions on work images; carousel dots in testimonials.
Failure Theme: Decorative script + generic sans without a disciplined scale; small overlaid text harms clarity.
Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors—Exemplar 8 and candidate_20 (both simpler). Deltas vs those: 1) this portfolio adds decorative script that reduces clarity, 2) caption text is smaller/overlaid, 3) inconsistent paragraph leading in testimonial card.
Score Justification: Multiple readability and consistency issues place hierarchy/readability sub‑factors at 2; template scent applies (cap ≤3). Final: 2.

layout_composition.explanation:
Observations: Centered hero on a large beige gradient background; content grouped into rounded rectangular panels; a row of three work tiles with device photos; two process cards; a testimonial card with avatar and carousel dots; contact block with large rounded-photo on the right.
Reconstruction: Grid/Spacing—single centered container with even gutters; rows stack vertically with generous padding. Image handling—work tiles use photographic device mocks with small, unreadable UI; process cards are diagram images with varying internal margins; testimonial layout has generous interior padding but long line length. Alignment is mostly centered; captions on work tiles are overlaid and left-aligned, creating mixed logic.
Link/State Audit: Navigation and slider arrows exist but states aren’t clearly signaled; no consistent CTA placement across sections.
Consistency Map: repeated rounded containers, consistent outer margins, recurring three‑across tile row, testimonial carousel module.
Failure Theme: Device‑mock collage with unreadable UI and mixed white balance; decorative background gradients distract; modules read like a template rather than a bespoke grid.
Anchor Comparison: Closest—candidate_20 and Exemplar 8. Deltas: 1) unreadable mocks across multiple tiles, 2) mixed image sources cause rhythm/value flicker, 3) carousel and card modules feel canned with little refinement.
Score Justification: Preflight—sloppy cues ≥3 (unreadable UI in 3 tiles; white‑balance mismatch across tiles) triggers red_flag and cap Layout ≤2. Even without cap, structure is generic. Final: 2.

color.explanation:
Observations: Site chrome uses a beige-to-warm gradient background; panels are lighter beige with soft shadows; work tiles are full‑color photos with differing white balance; small mauve/gray text and icons.
Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): Palette centers on warm neutrals, but the diverse photo tiles (brown table, gray blanket, white desktop) introduce inconsistent hues/values. No clear accent color for interactive elements; dots and arrows vary in visibility. Shadows are soft but add extra warmth that compounds the gradient.
Link/State Audit: Links/icons do not show a consistent accent or hover state; interactive color roles are unclear.
Consistency Map: warm neutral backgrounds throughout; rounded cards with the same beige; repeated thin black/gray underline rule under section headings.
Failure Theme: Value flicker from mixed, unharmonized imagery against a warm gradient shell; lack of defined accent/state system.
Anchor Comparison: Closest—candidate_20 and Exemplar 8. Deltas: 1) this page has stronger value flicker from photos, 2) gradient shell without neutral tuning to unify content, 3) absent link/state color logic.
Score Justification: Mismatched whites/tiles produce flicker; with sloppy_images causing value mismatch, Color is capped ≤2 by rule. Final: 2.

typography.explanation: Observations: (1) Large serif hero paragraph with comfortable rag at top-left. (2) Project captions under each tile use a small serif line with a leading dot and a lighter meta line below; top-right nav is a minimal sans. Reconstruction: Type Scale appears to be display serif for hero (~40–48px) with ~1.35–1.45 leading; captions ~14–16px with a lighter meta line; nav ~12–14px sans. Hierarchy is present via size and weight, but the pairing (serif body/captions + sans nav) is not strongly systemized across sections and some caption measures look tight. Link/State Audit: Navigation and footer links don’t show a consistent custom state or underline treatment; states are implied rather than explicit. Consistency Map: repeated caption pattern (leading dot + title + meta), consistent left alignment of captions, same serif voice for hero and captions across multiple tiles. Failure Theme: system feels generic with limited link-state craft; pairing lacks a clearly articulated scale across headings/labels; some captions read small. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 19/20 in overall feel—functional type with limited refinement. Compared to stronger anchors (Exemplar 5/6), this lacks tuned link styles, steady baseline rhythm, and visible micro-craft (underline weight/offset, punctuation spacing). Score Justification: Readable and competent, but no visible micro-craft to justify >3; defaults and missing states keep it at 3.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: (1) Two-up project grid with consistent gutters; alternating large single tile sections. (2) Multiple device-mock tiles where the UI inside laptops/phones is too small to read; a black footer bar overlaps/obscures partial logos beneath (visible cut-off crops). Reconstruction: Grid reads as a simple 2-column layout with even spacing and centered container. Captions sit consistently below tiles. However, the asset presentation relies on generic device frames with heavy shadows and varied background mats that create rhythm breaks. Link/State Audit: No clear card hover/state language visible; tiles behave like static images with captions. Consistency Map: repeated device-on-gradient tiles, recurrent caption position, uniform two-up grid. Failure Theme: device-mock collage with unreadable UI and cut-off elements; asset handling undermines rhythm and clarity. Anchor Comparison: Nearest anchor is Exemplar 20 (simple editorial grid) but this candidate shows more asset sloppiness vs that anchor; compared to Exemplar 11 (disciplined cards), mats/radii/reads are less controlled. Score Justification: Preflight triggers sloppy_images due to (a) unreadable small UI inside multiple devices, (b) generic, inconsistent device frames/shadows, (c) mismatched mats/value flicker, and (d) cut-off logos at the footer; per rules, Layout is capped at 2.

color.explanation: Observations: Strong, varied mats per tile—navy (GAP), coral/orange gradients (Shutterfly), cool blue gradients, pale gray—plus a solid black footer. These produce large value and hue jumps row-to-row. Reconstruction: Shell uses black on white for text, but there is no single accent or clear state color. Tiles follow brand colors of clients rather than a unifying portfolio palette; neutrals (grays, borders, shadows) are not doing visible work to harmonize content. Link/State Audit: No clear link color/states across nav or captions; footer links appear white on black without hover/visited cues. Consistency Map: repeated gradient mats but with unrelated hues; white page chrome; black footer. Failure Theme: value flicker from mismatched mats and a heavy footer; absence of accent/state logic to unify the page. Anchor Comparison: Compared to Exemplar 11 (tuned neutrals unify varied content), this page lacks mat/border unification; compared to Exemplar 6/5, accent strategy is undefined. Score Justification: Mixed mats and value jumps pull Color to 2; with sloppy_images triggering value flicker, Color is capped at 2.

typography.explanation: Observations: Three-column page with a large 'Hello, I’m Rasmus' hero, left and middle columns of linked lists (Projects, Thoughts & ideas), and a right editorial blurb with two small callout cards. Section labels and list items repeat across at least two columns. Reconstruction: Type Scale appears to be a single sans (likely Inter/system) with a big display H1, medium section heads, link titles, and small gray meta (dates). Body measures vary; the right-column paragraph runs long relative to its line-height, and list items feel tight (leading under ~1.35) which reduces readability. Hierarchy relies mostly on size/bold; limited use of spacing/tone. Link/State Audit: Links look like standard text color without distinctive underline tuning; affordance is often a trailing arrow (→) and light gray meta—no visible hover/visited logic in the capture. Consistency Map: repeated list-item pattern (title + short meta) across Projects and Thoughts; consistent section-heading style; repeated 'See all →' treatment; uniform arrow glyph usage. Failure Theme: Editorial minimal but under-tuned—hierarchy feels generic and leading/measure balance is not refined. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchor is Exemplar 20; similar minimal editorial structure and type decisions. Deltas vs stronger anchors (e.g., Exemplar 16/18): lacks tuned underlines/states, tighter baseline rhythm, and clearer modular scale. Score Justification: Readable but generic with minor rhythm/measure issues and no evident link-state craft, fitting a 2.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Rigid three-column grid with even gutters; content blocks align vertically across left/middle/right. Side rails in dark gray frame the canvas. Small promo cards on the right column break the list flow slightly. Reconstruction: Grid/Spacing appears fixed-width columns with consistent gutters; vertical rhythm varies—some list sections are dense while the right column blurb has looser spacing, creating energy imbalance. No imagery harmonization is needed here, but the page lacks focal hierarchy beyond the opening header; subsequent sections present as flat lists. Link/State Audit: CTAs like 'See all 73 projects →' sit as plain text links without extra spatial emphasis; navigation on the right shows a small orange dot indicator but no other evident state logic. Consistency Map: consistent three-column alignment, repeated list rhythm across two columns, repeated 'see-all' links at section ends. Failure Theme: Clean yet generic editorial layout with limited point of view and uneven vertical rhythm; minimal affordances. Anchor Comparison: Matches Exemplar 20’s structure and level of refinement; weaker than Exemplar 5/16 where rhythm, mats, and focal structure are more considered. Score Justification: Competent grid but lacks refinement and page-level decisions that would lift it—2 is appropriate.

color.explanation: Observations: Nearly monochrome shell—white canvas, dark text, dark gray side rails, and a single orange dot accent in the right column. Light gray meta text and subtle rules. Reconstruction: Unification & State Logic is minimal; neutrals appear close to pure black/white with little hue-shift; the heavy dark rails add value contrast that competes with content. Accent strategy is limited to the orange dot, without visible link/hover/visited differentiation. Link/State Audit: Links share the same text color as surrounding copy; no customized underline/hover color visible; orange dot likely indicates current section only. Consistency Map: consistent gray meta across list items; identical neutrals throughout; one accent (orange) used sparingly. Failure Theme: Default-leaning neutrals and absence of state color logic; high-contrast rails create value heaviness without adding structure. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 20; below stronger color systems (Exemplar 6/16/18) that tune neutrals and state roles. Score Justification: Serviceable palette but unsophisticated and state-light—lands at 2.

typography.explanation: Observations: Serif voice throughout; large intro paragraph spanning a wide measure; each role section shows company/role heading, a smaller italic date line, paragraph copy, and a consistent pill 'View work' link. Across multiple sections (Weights & Biases, Cruise, Inflect, etc.) the same styles repeat. Reconstruction (Type Scale): Display-sized intro (~H1), section headings (company + role) with weight contrast, meta/date in smaller italic, body copy with ~1.45–1.6 leading. Readability: Body paragraphs sit near the comfortable range, but the hero measure looks >85–90ch and reads long; some role headings and dates are close in size so hierarchy is more tonal than clearly stepped. Consistency: Repeated heading/date/body/pill pattern across all roles; consistent use of en-dash date ranges; uniform button labeling and casing. Micro-craft: tidy punctuation and en-dashes, stable paragraph spacing, but no visible tuned link underline/offset or advanced details; buttons look slightly over‑padded for the text size. Link/State Audit: Links appear as neutral pill buttons and a gold email link; hover/visited states not evidenced. Consistency Map: (1) company/role heading + date meta, (2) paragraph body style, (3) pill ‘View work’ treatment, (4) uniform section spacing. Failure Theme: Editorial but generic—long hero measure and limited hierarchy differentiation hold it back. Anchor Comparison: Closest to calibration candidate_9 (baseline 3) by structure; better than exemplar_4 (which felt looser) due to steadier spacing, but lacks the tuned hierarchy seen in higher anchors (e.g., exemplar_6/16 style precision). Score Justification: Competent, readable, consistent, but without the refined hierarchy and micro-link treatments to earn 4.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Single-column editorial layout with generous margins; repeated role sections stacked vertically; right-aligned small top nav; even vertical rhythm between entries. No screenshots—this page is résumé-style. Reconstruction (Grid/Spacing): Central content column with consistent section spacing; within each section a mini two-line header (company/role + date) followed by a paragraph and a left-aligned pill CTA. Gutters and inner spacing feel like an 8pt-derived system and repeat cleanly. Image/asset handling is not demonstrated. Link/State Audit: The pill CTA appears in each section with identical placement and size; no alternative states shown. Consistency Map: (1) repeated section module, (2) identical CTA placement, (3) consistent date alignment/format, (4) stable margins and baseline rhythm. Failure Theme: Safe, resume-like module repetition without a clear point of view or complex grid challenges; no asset harmonization to evaluate. Anchor Comparison: Closest to calibration candidate_9 (layout 3) — similar single-column, consistent but generic; clearly more organized than exemplar_4 (layout 1) yet not exhibiting the disciplined multi-grid or asset craft seen in exemplar_5/9. Score Justification: Clear and consistent, but conventional and light on compositional challenge—baseline 3.

color.explanation: Observations: Neutral off-white background with dark text; subtle gray pill outlines; a single warm accent (gold) used sparingly for the email link; monochrome social icons. Unification & State Logic: Conservative neutral shell avoids clashes; minimal accent strategy suggests role clarity (accent for a key link) but states are not shown. No imagery to unify, so no mat/border tuning demonstrated. Link/State Audit: Pill CTAs use neutral outline; the gold email link stands out as the lone accent; hover/visited not evidenced. Consistency Map: (1) consistent black/gray text, (2) gray outline pills across all sections, (3) accent gold used only for contact, (4) minimal, consistent neutrals across header/body/footer. Failure Theme: Safe but generic palette with limited state logic evidence. Anchor Comparison: Closest to calibration candidate_9 (color 3) — conservative neutrality; lacks the tuned neutrals and accent/state finesse seen in higher anchors like exemplar_6/9. Score Justification: Serviceable, harmonious, but not showcasing nuanced palette or state sophistication—baseline 3.

typography.explanation: Observations: Large editorial section names (e.g., “Column”, “Webflow Brand”, “Samsung”) set in a strong grotesk with generous tracking and precise left alignment. Small meta rows above each grid (Contribution / Role / Year) are consistently styled and evenly spaced; top‑nav is quiet and proportionate. No sloppy cues or template cues detected. Reconstruction: Type Scale shows disciplined steps—huge section headers, compact meta (likely 12–14px), and medium captions; leading appears ~1.3–1.4 for headers and ~1.5 for small text, keeping rhythm tight without collisions. Rags are clean; casing is consistent (title case for sections, small caps/upper for meta). Baselines between header, meta strip, and grid tiles are stable across all sections. Link/State Audit: Links in the nav and meta read as understated text links; the recurring M/L size toggle badges are consistently rendered and imply a selected state through filled circle. No default blue/underline appears. Consistency Map: (1) Section header + thin divider + meta strip pattern repeats across 6+ sections; (2) identical meta taxonomy (Contribution/Role/Year) styling; (3) uniform nav micro‑labels at top; (4) consistent typographic tone across dark and light image mats. Failure Theme: none material—typographic voice is controlled and confident throughout. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors Exemplar 5 and Exemplar 17; like Exemplar 5, it exhibits an editorial, highly disciplined scale and micro‑labels; compared to Exemplar 17 it’s more systematic with repeating meta bars and steadier baseline control. Score Justification: Clear multi‑level hierarchy, excellent rhythm/measure, and meticulous consistency across many sections warrant a 5.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Each project section uses a repeatable grid with equal‑sized tiles, even gutters, and consistent internal mats. The long page maintains alignment—section titles, meta strips, and tile grids all lock to the same left edge; hero is minimal (sticky note) with ample negative space. No cut‑off crops or irregular masonry; device frames (where present) are readable and harmonized. Reconstruction: Grid/Spacing appears to follow a fixed max‑width container with 3–4 column image grids; gutters are uniform; vertical rhythm between header, meta strip, and grid is repeatable. Captions/meta align to the grid start; section dividers are optically balanced so large headers don’t collide with content. Link/State Audit: Section badges (M/L) repeat in the same position; nav remains fixed and unobtrusive, ensuring a reliable reading path. Consistency Map: (1) Section header → meta → grid pattern repeated 6+ times; (2) identical tile dimensions and gutters within each section; (3) harmonized image presentation (matched mats/radii) despite varied artwork; (4) consistent left margin from top to bottom. Failure Theme: none—no value flicker from layout or gutter irregularities. Anchor Comparison: Most closely matches Exemplar 5, which also scores high for a long, disciplined grid; this page shows the same rigor and breadth. Score Justification: Mastery of alignment, spacing system, and asset handling across a long scroll merits a 5.

color.explanation: Observations: Neutral shell (soft white background, off‑black text) lets colorful project tiles carry identity. Within sections, tiles tend toward coordinated dark or mid‑value mats; accents are sparse and purposeful. Minor value variance appears where bright/pastel tiles neighbor dark ones (e.g., Assorted Sites and Archive & Scraps) but the neutral chrome prevents clashes. Reconstruction: Unification & State Logic—neutrals are tuned rather than pure #000/#fff; the same gray/black text tone recurs in nav, headers, and meta. Accents come from project imagery; there’s no noisy multi‑accent UI in the shell. Link/State Audit: Links/buttons are understated and rely on weight/placement rather than saturated hues; selected state for M/L badges is indicated with fill, consistent across sections. Consistency Map: (1) Neutral page chrome across all sections; (2) dark image mats often used to harmonize saturated artwork; (3) consistent text color hierarchy (headers vs meta). Failure Theme: slight value flicker from mixed light/dark tiles in Archive & Scraps and Assorted Sites prevents a 5. Anchor Comparison: Very close to Exemplar 5 (color=4). Compared to Exemplar 17, this page manages more diverse artwork with similar restraint; the small cross‑section value jumps keep it at 4. Score Justification: Harmonious, controlled palette with minor, acceptable variance—strong but not exceptional.

typography.explanation: Observations: 1) Hero “Hi, I’m Rajat” in a large sans (likely Inter) with the name in red; paragraph intro set left-aligned under it. 2) “Featured Projects” list on the left uses bold titles with lighter muted items; a caption under the right project tile uses small body text. 3) CTA section shows oversized 'Let’s Connect' display type with pill buttons. Preflight: template cues=2 ("I’m [Name]" hero; billboard-sized 'Let’s Connect'); sloppy cues=1 (small, unreadable UI text inside the device mock). Reconstruction (Type Scale): clear display H1 >> large project titles >> small meta/captions; body measure appears within ~55–65ch with comfortable leading. Hierarchy is driven by size + color contrast (red for emphasis). Readability: contrast is strong; paragraph lines are manageable; no collisions. Consistency: single-family sans throughout; headings and project titles reuse similar weights; links (e.g., repeated red 'NDA Protected') look like default underlined text—states/visited not shown. Micro‑craft: no visible underline tuning; baseline rhythm is acceptable but not demonstrably tuned; punctuation and rags are fine. Link/State Audit: red links with underlines appear in one area; no hover/visited proof; button states not shown. Consistency Map: repeated use of 1) red accent in headings/titles, 2) left-aligned blocks, 3) rounded pill buttons. Failure Theme: default-ish link treatment and oversized display moments overshadow the system; limited evidence of tuned micro‑craft. Anchor Comparison: Closest to calibration candidate_33 (baseline 3s). Compared to stronger anchors (exemplar_1/exemplar_6), this lacks tuned underlines, disciplined meta sizing across sections, and state logic. Score Justification: Readable and organized but generic; with limited state evidence and minimal micro-tuning, 3 is appropriate.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: 1) Two-column section with left project list and a right visual tile; ample white space. 2) A large 'Creative Canvas' box with a dotted grid and pinned cards; 3) A heavy red 'Let’s Connect' block with large rounded corners and two pill buttons. Preflight: no cut-off crops; one small unreadable device mock (sloppy=1); template cues=2 (intro hero; billboard-style footer title). Reconstruction (Grid/Spacing): predictable centered container; two-column layout for the work area; spacing feels on an 8/16 rhythm but not explicitly shown; captions and the project tile align to a common left edge. Image handling: the right tile has consistent radius/shadow; only one work tile shown, so consistency across a gallery isn’t demonstrated. The 'Creative Canvas' section is decorative and creates a long vertical gap, reducing rhythm. Link/State Audit: CTAs are clear pill buttons; no hover focus states are visible; inline links cluster under the tile. Consistency Map: 1) Rounded rectangles across card and footer; 2) Repeated left-column/text + right-visual pattern; 3) Even section padding along the page. Failure Theme: ornamental sections break momentum; sparse project grid limits proof of harmonized assets (mats, radii, captions) across multiple items. Anchor Comparison: Closest to candidate_33 (layout 3). Compared to exemplar_1/5 (score 4–5), this lacks disciplined multi-tile grids and refined asset harmonization. Score Justification: Solid baseline structure with good spacing, but not enough evidence or refinement to exceed 3.

color.explanation: Observations: strong red accent used in hero, project titles, and the large CTA section; base is near black on white. Project visual introduces a purple screen that isn’t harmonized by mats. Preflight: no value-flicker from mismatched whites across tiles; one decorative dotted background overlay in hero is subtle. Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): Palette = black/white base + a single saturated red accent. The purple in the project screenshot reads as content rather than system color. Neutrals look close to pure #000/#fff; border/shadow tints are minimal. Link/State Audit: red underlined text suggests link color, but hover/visited logic not shown; CTA buttons use white fill with red text/border. Consistency Map: 1) Red accent consistently highlights titles and CTAs; 2) White chrome used throughout; 3) Buttons maintain a white-on-red logic. Failure Theme: accent is heavy in the footer; neutrals appear un-tuned, and there’s limited proof of state logic or unifying mats for colorful screenshots. Anchor Comparison: Closest to candidate_33 (color 3). Stronger anchors (exemplar_6) show tuned grays and harmonization of content color; this does not. Score Justification: Serviceable, consistent accent use but lacking refined neutrals and unification tactics, so a 3.

typography.explanation: Observations: Left rail with small italic nav, vertical divider, and a single right-column text block. Link/State Audit: Body links share a consistent blue + underline treatment; left-rail shows an active state (darker) vs lighter inactive items, implying state logic. Consistency Map: (1) Same link treatment across inline links, (2) consistent paragraph spacing and measure, (3) left-rail nav style repeats with weight/tone to show active vs inactive. Failure Theme: Conservative, default-leaning link styling (likely default underline weight/offset), limited hierarchy beyond H1/body, no evidence of advanced micro-craft (custom underlines, small-caps, optical tweaks) across multiple sections. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors are candidate_33 (baseline 3/3/3) and the editorial-minimal style of Exemplar 18; compared to those, this page shows similar readability but lacks the refined link treatments and broader proof of typographic system. Score Justification: Readable and orderly with a clear but simple hierarchy; single-view evidence caps it at 3.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Two-column structure with fixed left rail and a comfortable content column; generous side gutters and a light divider. Paragraph stack keeps a steady vertical rhythm. Link/State Audit: Navigation indicates current section via tone; inline links are not positioned as CTAs and do not disrupt the grid. Anchor Comparison: Closest to candidate_33 baseline; less complex than Exemplar 18’s broader system with multiple modules. color.explanation: Observations: Neutral off-white background, dark gray body text, lighter gray for inactive nav, subtle divider line, and blue links. typography.explanation: Observations: Hero shows a clear, bold headline with a comfortable measure and a light meta line beneath; navigation is small and restrained; project cards use a consistent title + short description pattern; captions and eyebrow labels (e.g., Selected Works, Past Projects) are tidy. layout_composition.explanation: Observations: A clean two‑column grid for the hero (left text, right portrait) followed by a disciplined 2x2 project grid with equal gutters and identical card radii; past projects continue the same card rhythm and spacing. color.explanation: Observations: Off‑white page shell with tuned gray/black text; project tiles use soft pastel mats (light blue, cream, blush) that unify varied screenshots and illustrations; black‑and‑white portrait keeps the hero calm. typography.explanation: Observations: Large left-aligned H1 “Hey, I’m Robin” set in a modern grotesk; right column intro copy with comfortable measure; secondary H2 “Nice to meet you” repeats the scale; small, quiet nav links top-right. layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Two-column hero with balanced white space; second section mirrors a two-column grid (text left, portrait right); footer band aligns to the same container. color.explanation: Observations: Neutral off-white background with off-black text; a light gray footer band; single color comes from the photo (blue sky, natural tones). typography.explanation: Observations: 1) Large centered hero “I’m Eric Hishinuma…” set in a common geometric sans with very heavy weight; subcopy is small and light. 2) Section labels like “Selected work” and project titles use close sizes/weights with minimal tonal contrast; captions run long and look light against large images. Reconstruction: Type Scale shows a big jump from oversized H1 to small body with few intermediate steps; body measure appears wide and leading loose; hierarchy leans on weight changes rather than scale/spacing; link text (e.g., See All Work) looks default-ish and doesn’t show custom underline logic. Consistency Map: repeated use of bold display for titles, light captions below large renders, and identical small meta labels under each project. Compared with stronger anchors like Exemplar 1/6, this lacks tuned link underlines, disciplined small caps/meta rhythm, and a visible modular scale across sections. layout_composition.explanation: Observations: 1) Centered hero followed by a generic “Selected work” stream of large renders. 2) Each project shows a different device render ratio (angled desktop, overlapping browser windows, a wide monitor, a phone) creating uneven negative space. Reconstruction: Grid appears single-column centered with wide container; gutters/vertical rhythm are adequate but not tuned; titles/captions left‑aligned under very large images; the top-right “See All Work” floats visually apart from the grid. Image handling: device renders dominate while UI details are unreadable at presented sizes; aspect ratios vary, and mats/radii logic isn’t evident. Link/State Audit: Navigation pills and the Contact chip float above the grid; CTAs per project are absent. Consistency Map: repeated pattern of big mock → small title → single‑line description; repeated but not refined. Failure Theme: device‑render collage with inconsistent ratios and scale control; generic section structure. Anchor Comparison: Matches Exemplar 3. Versus stronger anchors (Exemplar 5/11), this lacks harmonized mats/radii, disciplined caption alignment and even gutters across long sequences. color.explanation: Observations: 1) Predominantly pure white chrome with saturated device renders (blue charts, dark mode phone, colorful dashboards) causing value flicker. 2) Accent choices are inconsistent (orange Contact chip, blue link accents in project UIs) without a unified role system. Reconstruction: No visible neutral tuning (reads as #fff with near‑black text); mats/borders are minimal so imagery sets the palette; no border tints/shadow logic to unify diverse screenshots. Link/State Audit: Links vs buttons don’t show a consistent color role or states. Consistency Map: white background across sections, colorful hero logo chip, and diverse project imagery—consistent only in being uncontrolled by the shell. Failure Theme: lack of unifying neutral/overlay system; reliance on screenshot colors. Anchor Comparison: Same as Exemplar 3; compared to tuned color systems in Exemplar 1/6, this lacks off‑whites, subtle dividers, or hue‑shifted borders to harmonize content. Score Justification: Color feels default and unintegrated; role logic absent → 1.

typography.explanation: Observations: Hero uses a large display sans (likely Inter/General Sans family) with strong weight contrast; right column bio shows comfortable paragraph measure. Project tiles repeat a title + meta line (company • type • year) and a small 'SHIPPED' pill in uppercase. Rags are clean across the grid. Preflight: sloppy cues = 0; template cues = 2 ("Hello, I'm [Name]" hero; uniform card grid) — below thresholds. Reconstruction (Type Scale): H1 very large (~72–88px) with tight leading; H2/Tile titles ~20–24px, body/meta ~14–16px; leading ~1.4; titles in sentence case, meta in muted gray for hierarchy. Readability: body blocks on the right column and tile captions sit around 55–70ch with comfortable spacing and contrast. Consistency: the pill tags use consistent all‑caps tracking; meta separators and date placement repeat on every card; nav uses the same sans with an active chip. Micro‑craft: tidy punctuation, consistent cap/lowercase treatment, even spacing between title and meta on all cards, stable baselines in multi‑line captions. Link/State Audit: active state in top nav is clearly indicated via a rounded chip; tiles imply whole‑card link without underlines—conservative and consistent. Consistency Map: (1) Title + meta stack under every thumbnail, (2) identical 'SHIPPED' pill styling where applicable, (3) nav chip treatment for the active page. Failure Theme: minor generic hero copy; no explicit link underline/state treatment demonstrated within captions. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors Exemplar 19 and Exemplar 5. Similar disciplined sans hierarchy and repeated meta system; not as editorially sharp as Exemplar 5’s typographic POV nor as minimal as 19’s content shell. Score Justification: Clear, readable hierarchy and repeated styles across many tiles with minor gaps in explicit link/state detailing merits a strong 4.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: A two‑column hero pairs large type (left) with bio card (right). Below, a three‑column project grid runs the full page with consistent gutters and card sizes. Each tile has a mat with matched radii and a consistent caption block below. Preflight: sloppy cues = 0 (no cut‑offs, no unreadable device frames, even gutters); template cues = 2 (hero pattern; uniform grid) — below caps. Reconstruction (Grid/Spacing): Likely 12‑col container with 3 equal content columns; gutters appear even; vertical rhythm between rows is consistent. Captions align flush left under each card; pills sit in predictable positions. Image handling: thumbnails are harmonized with identical corner radii, subtle shadows, and consistent mat margins; no ragged masonry or odd aspect jumps. Link/State Audit: Active nav chip anchors the scan path; cards read as tap/hover targets with clear hit areas. Consistency Map: (1) Repeated card proportions and radii, (2) identical caption stack placement and spacing, (3) uniform row rhythm from top to bottom. Failure Theme: Conventional structure without standout structural innovation; some thumbnails include small UI details that aren’t readable at this zoom, but they’re used as illustrations rather than primary content. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 19; more varied mats than 19, but less structural invention than Exemplar 5’s dense case grids. Score Justification: Cohesive grid, disciplined assets, and clean rhythm throughout meet a strong 4; not pushing into 5 due to conservative structure and limited breakpoint evidence.

color.explanation: Observations: Neutral off‑white page background with off‑black text. Cards use a controlled range of muted yet lively mats (lavender, forest green, mustard, pink, slate, olive) that balance saturation and value to avoid flicker. Pills and meta text sit in restrained grays. Preflight: no mismatched whites or harsh #000/#fff; no noisy logo rows; accents are controlled. Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): The shell’s neutrals unify diverse thumbnails; mats carry identity per project while staying within a similar value band. Active nav chip uses a soft gray fill; CTA roles are subtle but consistent. Link/State Audit: Active state is clear in nav; links in captions aren’t overt but the card‑as‑link pattern implies state without clashing colors. Consistency Map: (1) Reused muted color mats with similar value, (2) gray meta lines and tags across all tiles, (3) consistent shadow/border tint logic across images. Failure Theme: Minor value jumps between especially dark/bright mats exist but are generally balanced across rows; no explicit hover/visited palette shown. Anchor Comparison: Similar to Exemplar 19’s tuned neutrals; not as identity‑driven as Exemplar 5 but shows good control. Score Justification: Harmonious palette with disciplined neutrals and accents; small gaps in state palette demonstration keep it at a solid 4.

typography.explanation: Observations: Display serif headings (e.g., “Discord Mobile Redesign,” “Blitz,” “Airbase”) contrasted with a clean sans body across multiple sections; right‑aligned meta labels/dates repeat; long‑form copy blocks near bottom keep a steady rag and comfortable measure. Preflight: no default link blue, no mismatched radii, no cut‑off crops. Reconstruction (Type Scale): H1/section titles in a high‑contrast serif with tighter leading; H2/meta set in smaller sans with modest tracking; body copy ~60–70ch with ~1.5 leading; title casing consistent; punctuation and quotes appear clean. Readability: contrast is strong on warm off‑white; footer flips to dark with sufficient contrast. Link/State Audit: CTAs/meta links on the right use subtle, custom styling (not default blue) and maintain weight/size discipline relative to body. Consistency Map: (1) Same serif for all project titles, (2) same sans for body/meta, (3) repeated right‑aligned meta/CTA line on each project, (4) consistent title-to-image spacing rhythm across sections. Failure Theme: slightly small body size in a few synopsis lines and one or two dense meta rows; not enough visible link states to verify hover/visited system. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors Exemplar 6 and Exemplar 1. Similar editorial restraint and tuned neutrals; slightly less link/state evidence and a touch more decorative display than Exemplar 6 keeps it at 4. Score Justification: Strong hierarchy and rhythm across many sections with minor gaps in state proof → 4.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Section intros align to a consistent left column with ample negative space; large, readable hero images per project (Discord mobile, Communities, Blitz, Whiteboard, Airbase) sit on matched widths; the values/contact area uses a tidy two‑column split; footer grid is structured and dense yet orderly. Preflight: no irregular gutters, no tiny unreadable device collages, no visible cut‑offs. Grid/Spacing Reconstruction: Single wide container with consistent insets; vertical rhythm appears on an 8px/12px cadence; right rail hosts compact meta links; image mats and captions align to the same column width. Image handling: gradients and mats are cohesive; device frames used sparingly and at readable scale. Link/State Audit: Repeated placement of small CTAs on the right gives a stable reading path; nothing floats off‑grid. Consistency Map: (1) Title + meta row layout repeats on every project, (2) identical image width and top/bottom paddings, (3) two‑column info block near bottom mirrors earlier grid, (4) footer uses a tight grid echoing the main rhythm. Failure Theme: a single angled collage (Airbase) slightly reduces screenshot legibility; a few hero images carry strong gradients that introduce mild value jumps. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 6/1 for disciplined, editorial layout; falls short of Exemplar 5’s museum‑grade rigor in harmonizing many thumbnails. Score Justification: Cohesive, confident structure and harmonized assets with minor roughness → 4.

color.explanation: Observations: Warm off‑white shell with charcoal text; project canvases use soft gradients (Discord, Blitz) without clashing; footer flips to a deep navy/charcoal with a restrained accent grid. Preflight: no harsh #000/#fff pairing; no noisy logo rows; minimal value flicker. Unification & State Logic: Neutrals are tuned (warm background, off‑black text); accents live mostly inside project artwork; CTAs/meta links are understated and consistent. Integration: varied artwork (dark Blitz UI, pastel Discord gradients, white Airbase dashboards) remains cohesive due to steady shell and spacing; footer dark mode maintains contrast and identity. Consistency Map: (1) Same warm background throughout, (2) accent gradients within tiles but minimized in chrome, (3) dark footer consistently applied, (4) images retain compatible saturation levels. Failure Theme: a couple of saturated gradients push value contrast more than needed and one collage mixes light/dark panes, adding slight flicker. Anchor Comparison: Similar to Exemplar 6’s tuned neutrals and accent restraint; not as museum‑level unified as Exemplar 5. Score Justification: Harmonious palette with clear roles and minor flicker keeps it at a strong 4.

typography.explanation: Preflight findings: template cues (2) — “I am [Name]” hero and left‑text/right‑visual hero; sloppy cues (2) — mixed tile mats causing value flicker and ragged masonry row bottoms. Observations: 1) Hero uses a clean sans with a large H1 on a dark background; paragraph copy under it is readable. 2) Project captions below tiles repeat a small title + lighter meta label and maintain consistent alignment. Reconstruction — Type Scale: clear H1, paragraph body, caption/title, and small meta; leading appears ~1.4–1.6 and measures remain controlled. Consistency: caption style repeats under all tiles; nav labels match body tone. Micro‑craft: no obvious tracking issues; quotes and punctuation look clean, but no evidence of tuned link underlines or advanced details. Link/State Audit: one bordered “More about me” CTA and minimal nav; hover/visited states not visible. Consistency Map: repeated caption pair (title/meta), consistent left alignment in captions, uniform weight usage for hero/body, and consistent button style. Failure Theme: generic hierarchy with limited state treatment; lacks visible link/underline tuning. Anchor Comparison: closest to Exemplar 8 and 19 — similar restrained sans system; unlike stronger anchors (e.g., Exemplar 16), there’s no evidence of underline tuning or advanced rhythm across long pages. layout_composition.explanation: Preflight findings: sloppy cues (2) — ragged masonry row bottoms/top misalignment and mixed light/dark mats across tiles; template cues (2) as noted. Observations: 1) Structured hero with clear left column text and right visual field; 2) Two‑column project grid with even gutters and consistent caption placement. Reconstruction — Grid/Spacing: centered page container with a stable two‑column grid, generous outer margins, and consistent tile gutters; captions align to tile left edges. Image handling shows browser‑frame mocks and one device collage. Link/State Audit: clear CTA in hero and scroll cue; tiles imply click‑through but states are not shown. Consistency Map: repeated two‑column tile rhythm, consistent caption placements, recurring browser‑frame presentation, and uniform tile paddings/shadows. Failure Theme: value flicker and mixed presentation styles (dark browser frames vs light device collage) disrupt rhythm; masonry creates uneven baselines. Lacks the impeccably harmonized asset handling seen in stronger anchors (e.g., Exemplar 5). color.explanation: Preflight findings: minor value flicker from mixed tile backgrounds (dark hero, alternating dark/very light mats). Observations: 1) Hero uses a deep green‑black with white text and subtle dotted accent, producing good contrast. 2) Work tiles alternate between dark UI on dark mats and light grey/white collages. Reconstruction — Unification & State Logic: neutrals appear slightly off‑black rather than pure #000, which helps; accent color strategy is minimal and conservative; no explicit link/hover states are visible. Integration with imagery: lack of a consistent mat color or border tint to harmonize diverse screenshots leads to flicker. Consistency Map: dark hero shell, subdued captions, restrained color usage within chrome, subtle tile shadows. Failure Theme: inconsistent mats and device collage introduce noise; accent/state logic not demonstrated. Anchor Comparison: similar to Exemplar 8 in conservative palette; below stronger examples (Exemplars 5/16) that unify screenshots via consistent mats/borders. Score Justification: conservative and serviceable, but not showing the unification rigor needed for 4.

typography.explanation: Observations: Hero heading “Hi, I’m Saebom!” with a short subhead is clean and left‑aligned. Section titles (Selected Work, About, Fun) read clearly. Project cards show a title + short meta line; About section has a comfortable paragraph; Experience rows use a simple label/value line. Reconstruction: Type Scale appears to be a single sans family with 3–4 steps (hero > section title > card title > body/meta). Measures are reasonable (~55–70ch in About) with adequate leading; rags are controlled. Hierarchy relies on size + weight; chips/buttons keep casing consistent. Link/State Audit: CTAs are consistently rendered as black pill buttons; inline links are minimal and do not rely on default blue. No visible hover/visited states, but CTA affordance is clear. Consistency Map: repeated pill CTAs, rounded label chips on cards, same family/weights across sections, stable left alignment. Failure Theme: overall generic voice; some micro inconsistencies (different CTA copy like “Read More” vs “Contact Me?”; no visible link state tuning). Anchor Comparison: Closest anchor is Exemplar 8 (typography 2). This page is slightly better due to: 1) more consistent scale between sections, 2) comfortable body measure and leading in About, 3) disciplined casing and absence of default blue underlines. Score Justification: Readable and orderly but not distinctive—meets competent baseline.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Long single column with a hero block followed by stacked project cards, then an About two‑column block, an experience list, and a mixed Fun grid with thumbnails. Project cards place blurred environment images with monitor/device frames containing small UI; a chip label sits top‑left; a pill CTA floats top‑right. Reconstruction: Grid/Spacing shows a consistent container width and even vertical spacing, but asset handling is weak—device frames dominate while UI is tiny and unreadable; mats and backgrounds vary by card. The About section aligns image and text well, but the Fun section mixes placeholder grey card, product photo, and travel thumbnails with inconsistent focal weights. Consistency Map: repeated rounded cards, pill CTAs, and chips do exist, but asset presentation breaks rhythm. Failure Theme: device‑frame collage with tiny unreadable UI, mismatched background mats causing value flicker, and a placeholder “Coming Soon” tile undermining cohesion. Preflight: sloppy cues ≥3 — unreadable small UI inside device frames (multiple cards), device‑frame collage pattern, mismatched mats/whites producing value flicker. This triggers red_flag 'sloppy_images' and caps Layout ≤2. Anchor Comparison: Exemplar 8 (layout 3) handles screenshots with cleaner mats and more consistent tiles; here the collage and unreadable mocks reduce craft by a full step. typography.explanation: Observations: Clean sans-serif throughout; centered intro paragraph with comfortable measure; H2 'Featured work' sized appropriately; links (e.g., company name, footer credit) use a blue color without custom underline. Across the two project tiles, no captions or complex text to stress the system. typography.explanation: Observations: Hero “I’m Priyanka” uses an italic accent and warm neutral body copy; project cards show consistent small meta labels with icons; the dark About block keeps the same scale and CTA style; section title “Designing for Impact” repeats the accent color on the final word. typography.explanation: Observations: Large all‑caps nameplate over a burgundy hero; small uppercase subline; project captions under each tile (e.g., Sunflower, Xbox) in a light sans; footer headings ('Let's chat!') with curly apostrophe and simple body copy; contact links appear default blue and underlined. typography.explanation: Observations: Header uses small caps/letterspaced labels (“Product Designer”, location) with a centered name/mark; project tiles show a bold title with a lighter meta line under each image; footer contains small monochrome social icons. Versus Ex.19, it’s less expressive and has a smaller, flatter scale. Score Justification: Readable and consistent but generic; with missing link/state proof, this stays at a competent 3.

color.explanation: Observations: Shell is white with black/gray text; no discernible accent. Tiles introduce disparate hues: warm wood, cool office lighting, outdoor browns/greens. typography.explanation: Observations: Large, confident sans-serif headline with clean rags; project captions use a compact meta style (title + one-line description + city/year); About section shows reversed type with consistent subheads (Services, Clients, Locations, Press). Reconstruction: Type Scale—display H1 followed by a clear section H2 (Projects/About), small meta for captions; leading looks ~1.2 for display and ~1.45–1.55 for body; measures stay within ~55–75ch. Micro‑craft—well‑set em dash, stable baselines between headings and body, link underlining on “Allbirds” is weight‑appropriate and offset cleanly, no widows/orphans visible. Link/State Audit: Link styling relies on an underline in body copy; a single ghost button “Contact” suggests a restrained CTA style, but hover/visited states are not evidenced. layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Full‑bleed hero image sets focus; subsequent text blocks respect a fixed content width; Projects grid shows even gutters and aligned bottoms; About section forms a balanced two‑column structure (left image, right multi‑column content) with a clearly placed Contact CTA. typography.explanation: Observations: Centered hero with a large H1 (“Hello! I'm Dorna Mehrkish.”), short intro paragraph below with a blue underlined link, and a two‑column grid of project cards each using a bold title with a smaller gray description; footer shows small utility text and social icons.
